title: Add keywords and categories for crates.io.
body: This may make it easier for people to find these crates.

title: Change return type of rumqttc event loop
body:
Hi!
First of all, thank you all for working on this very nice mqtt library. Looking through the code I was a little bit surprised by the choice that the rumqttc eventloop yielded
```rust
Result<(Option<Incoming>, Option<Outgoing>), ConnectionError>.
```
which made it non-obvious if it could be the case that both an incoming and an outgoing event would be available at the same time and/or if it might be possible that there might be no event at all. This pull request changes the return type to
```rust
Result<Event, ConnectionError>
```
where the event is just
```rust
pub enum Event {
    Incoming(Incoming),
    Outgoing(Outgoing),
}
```
However, since I'm not familiar with this code, there might be a good reason for the previous design choice, so please don't feel pressured to accept this pull request.

title: Fix warnings.
body: I somehow forgot to fix these in my last pull request.

title: Cleanup
body:
Run cargo fmt, and fix warnings about the return value of std::mem::replace being unused by just assigning instead.

Fixes #125.

title: Add Unsubscribe::new method, similar to Subscribe::new.
Use Bytes rather than String for LastWill.
body:
This also adds a constructor, consistent with Publish.

Fixes #122.

title: No need for EventLoop::new to be async.
body: It never calls await, so the async declaration is unnecessary.

title: Use incoming max size from options
Don't lose pkid, dup and retain when converting Publish to PublishRaw.
body: This fixes bug #105, which was introduced by pull #99.

title: Allow rustls::ClientConfig to be injected via MqttOptions.
body: This allows the caller to easily integrate with rustls-native-certs or webpki-roots to use standard root CA certs, or change other configuration beyond the options currently supported by MqttOptions.

title: RawPublish
body: * Serialize publishes at source for better cpu distribution

title: Fix compilation error in state.rs
body:
This PR fixes a compilation error in the the `rumqttc` crate on the `master` branch:

```
error[E0599]: no associated item named `MAX` found for type `u16` in the current scope
  --> /home/dwagner/.cargo/git/checkouts/rumqtt-5c5ad7136a67b3df/b57ffbf/rumqttc/src/state.rs:78:43
   |
78 |             incoming_pub: vec![None; u16::MAX as usize + 1],
   |                                           ^^^ associated item not found in `u16`
   |
help: you are looking for the module in `std`, not the primitive type
   |
78 |             incoming_pub: vec![None; std::u16::MAX as usize + 1],

```

I used the following compiler
```
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.41.0
```

title: Timeout configurable[Ready]
body:
- `Timeout` is a `MqttOptions` variable
- A new member introduced to `EventLoop` struct of type `Duration`.
-  Default value is `5s`

title: Fix compilation on Windows
body: `rumqttlog` - and by extension its dependents - cannot currently be compiled on and for Windows because `std::os::unix` is used unconditionally in the `segment` module. This change adds a conditionally-compiled inline function that keeps the current code for Unix systems while implementing a slightly different version for Windows.

title: Remove old broker and rename client
make requests generic instead of boxed
Ecc key
body:
Changes summary:

- Added `key_type` attribute to MqttOptions of Type `Option<String>`
- Panics if `key_type` supplied by user is illegal.
- Call appropriate key reading api depending upon type of key.
- By default assume `RSA`.
